SENT.plain: Laparoscopic colectomy is now widely applied to cases of malignancy, supported by early data from several large randomized controlled trials
Long-term follow-up is now available from those trials, supporting equivalency of cancer-free and overall survival for open and laparoscopic resections
This promising data has inspired further exploration of other applications of laparoscopic techniques, including use of single incision laparoscopy
This article reviews recent reports of long-term data for colorectal cancer resection from four randomized, prospective international trials
